# Lektr

> A self-hosted, local-first platform to aggregate, organize, and review your reading highlights.

Lektr is an open-source knowledge preservation engine for avid readers who want to own their data. It consolidates highlights from Kindle, KOReader, Readwise, and web sources into a beautiful, searchable interface with spaced repetition review.

## Technical Stack

- **Runtime**: Bun
- **Backend**: Hono.js + Drizzle ORM
- **Database**: PostgreSQL with pgvector extension
- **Frontend**: Next.js 16, Tailwind CSS, Framer Motion
- **AI**: Local embeddings via Hugging Face Transformers

## Key Features

- Universal import (Kindle, KOReader, Readwise, manual)
- Semantic search with vector embeddings
- Spaced repetition review (FSRS algorithm)
- Self-hosted with Docker
- Local-first, privacy-focused

## API

The API is built with Hono.js and uses OpenAPI for documentation. Key endpoints:

- `/api/auth/*` - Authentication (register, login, logout)
- `/api/books/*` - Book management
- `/api/import/*` - Highlight import
- `/api/review/*` - Spaced repetition review
- `/api/search/*` - Semantic search
- `/api/tags/*` - Tag management
